Manager, Inside Sales

The ideal candidate will be someone who displays a passion for growing a business, strategizes and creates efficiencies to achieve monthly and annual sales goals, focuses on an exceptional client experience, leads with a servant’s heart, and maintains a high commitment to personal and professional growth.

The Manager, Inside Sales is responsible for providing support and guidance to the inside sales team in order to accomplish business goals. They will work alongside the Director of Inside Sales in developing and monitoring the contact center, increasing per agent productivity, enhancing stakeholder relationships, and meeting mutually agreed upon KPI metrics established with the MSRE Senior Leadership Team.

The Manager, Inside Sales will require a willingness to do whatever it takes, including but not limited to relocating, to optimize sales performance and operation initiatives.  A strong leader will take ownership of developing a successful contact center as the entire organization relies on the inside sales team to advance the client experience. They must be disciplined and task focused to successfully complete their work.

Regular Work Activities:

Drive results by setting KPI targets and regularly monitoring performance Create growth and accountability plans as well as sales execution processes  Quality assurance monitoring of systems and processes Implement sales strategies and coach on the individual and team level  Working closely with IT & Marketing to report issues and identify areas for improvement Create content and lead team meetings and huddles Working closely with the Director of Inside Sales and MSRE Senior Leadership to identify challenges and recommend strategy to increase productivity Support call calibration and call review initiatives Partner with the Training Department and Inside Sales Development Specialist to design training curriculum within time and budget constraints  Monitor SalesForce,  Five9 compliance, and CRM Training support Monitor the inside sales support ticketing management system Build strong cross functional relationships Support onboarding, training and new hire certifications  Conduct system gap analyses to identify areas of improvement

Key Skills:

Solid written and verbal presentation and communication abilities Proficient with Customer Relations Management software (SalesForce preferred), Microsoft Office Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), Google Applications, and Five9 Results oriented with the ability to meet and exceed goals Excellent organizational abilities Quick thinker and calm under pressure

Compensation:

Competitive base salary with performance bonuses, full health benefits, and 401k match

Job Requirements:

High School Graduate and Bachelor’s degree preferred Proven one to three years of sales management and/or sales operations experience Experience with CRMs (Salesforce) and call center software (Five9) is a plus

Department Hours of Operation: Sun-Sat: 8:30 AM EST – 8:30 PM EST

Hours worked may vary between 40 and 60 hours per week to meet goals. Available on nights and weekends, as scheduled/needed

Sales Performance Coach

The ideal candidate is an engaging and inspiring coach who holds themselves accountable to transaction goals, invests in the development of others, focuses on an exceptional client experience, leads with a servant’s heart, and maintains a high commitment to personal and professional growth, and. 

The Sales Performance Coach is responsible for improving the effectiveness of sales processes. They will work alongside the Director of Inside Sales in performance coaching the Inside Sales team, building a talent bench of future leaders, reducing turnover by increasing employee performance, and meeting mutually agreed upon KPI metrics established with the MSRE Senior Leadership Team.

The  Sales Performance Coach will require a willingness to do whatever it takes, including but not limited to working nights and weekends to meet department targets while delivering an excellent client experience.  A strong Sales Performance Coach will take ownership of creating and developing performance plans and reporting on the progress of the team.  The Sales Performance Coach must be disciplined about their time and task focused to successfully complete their work.  

Regular Work Activities:

Provide individual and team coaching sessions  Source candidates for the team Conduct team meetings & huddles Work closely with the ISAs to identify challenges they face on-the-job and recommend ways to increase productivity Shadow calls and provide performance feedback to lift results Coordinate call calibrations and call reviews Partner with the Training Department to design training curricula within time and budget constraints (Litmos, QRGs, Certifications, Playbooks, Presentations) Report and track the impact of training programs Provide vendor support and conduct all vendor-specific training Monitor SalesForce compliance and conduct CRM Training Host office hours and roundtable training sessions for ISA development Conduct onboarding, training and new hire certifications  Promote personal development activities for the ISAs and brainstorm incentive programs Conduct skills gap analyses to identify areas of improvement Deliver formal performance reviews with proper documentation of progress

Key Skills:

Solid presentation and communication abilities, both written and verbal Proficient with Customer Relations Management software (SalesForce), Microsoft Office Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), Google Applications, and Five9 Ability to influence and build relationships Excellent organizational skills Ability to create and implement training programs  Quick thinker and calm under pressure 

Compensation:

Base salary with performance bonuses, full health benefits, and 401k match

Job Requirements:

High School Graduate and Bachelor’s degree preferred Proven one to three years of performance coaching and/or sales training experience Additional certifications in sales coaching/training is a plus

Department Hours of Operation: Sun-Sat: 8:30 AM EST – 8:30 PM EST

Hours worked may vary between 40 and 60 hours per week to meet goals. Available on nights and weekends, as scheduled/needed

Digital Marketing Director

About David Marshall: 

David Marshall Team is a full-service brokerage with the best personalized options to suit our clients’ needs. Additionally, David Marshall Team is the most trusted name in real estate, earning more 5-star reviews than any other firm in the United States. It has earned the No. 1 real estate team in the Nation honor the last four consecutive years by the Wall Street Journal and Real Trends for annual sales production and is a six-time Inc. 5000 recipient, an annual list honoring the fastest-growing private companies in America. The company was honored in 2017, 2018, 2020 and 2021 as one of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution’s Top Workplaces. It has earned the Atlanta Business Chronicle Pacesetter Award the last five years, as one of metro Atlanta’s 100 top, fastest-growing, privately held companies. David Marshall Team made its fourth appearance on Atlanta’s Top 25 Team Companies annual list in 2021 and made its second appearance on similar lists in both Charlotte and Raleigh.

Currently we are serving six states and 13 markets. Our agents are local, experienced, highly trained, and working full time in the real estate business to make sure your goals are achieved.

The firm had a record sales year again in 2021, with more than $3.3 billion in gross sales volume and sold over 10,300 homes. 

About the Role:

Alpharetta, Georgia (On-Site)

Join one of America’s fastest growing companies! We’re looking for an experienced, data-oriented Digital Marketing Director to join our fast-growing team. As Digital Marketing Director you will own all aspects of digital paid media including SEM, display ads, and social media for David Marshall Team. The ideal candidate will have a degree and/or certifications in a related field and have demonstrated proficiency in Search, Display, and Social Media Advertising with budgets of at least $100,000 per month. We’re looking for an individual contributor who can work seamlessly with company members, agency partners and vendors. You should be comfortable managing an agency or overseeing and doing the work internally.

Your Background:

3+ years of paid digital marketing work experience, with 2+ years of Google Ads account management experience Proficiency with social media platforms and digital marketing tools. Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, journalism, or related studies, related certifications and proficient work experience. Certifications and proficiency in Google Ads and Google Analytics Facebook Blueprint Certification Familiarity with media vendors, platforms, verification partners and DSPs such as Display and Video 360, Amobee, Centro, The Trade Desk, etc.

Salary and Benefits Information: 

Compensation will be a combination of base salary and quarterly incentives. 

Benefits include but not limited to

Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance

401k with company match 

Paid time off and company holidays

Mass Media Marketing Coordinator

The Mass Media Marketing Coordinator role is responsible for supporting the Mass Media team, Marketing team, and company with tasks including but not limited to the following: 

Own all administrative duties of the mass media marketing team with excellence, precision, and timeliness Support Mass Media Director(s): Audit and archive added value elements by source Research and provide contact information for expansion markets Listen to radio ads for quality assurance and archive Send and confirm traffic instructions by source Organize and maintain mass media Google drive assets  Lead mass media reporting, including expense accuracy, source management on the website and in SF, and accurate daily, weekly, and monthly reporting on leads and CPLs by source.  Ensure all daily reporting per source is being sent accurately to vendors and in a timely manner. Ensure sources have NDA on file.  Lead Mass Media Virtual Assistant in the completion of reporting responsibilities  Ensure billboard audit is done monthly and summaries are saved to drive Manage media monitors agreement and renewal. Ensure all media monitor data is updated weekly and accurately reported. 

This position reports to our Alpharetta Headquarters Monday-Friday.

Additionally, you will support and assist with the following: 

All mass media reporting  Tracking and porting of all mass media contracts  Build strong rapport with representatives for all mass media sources Keep up-to-date mass media trackers Research additional philanthropic initiatives to explore sponsored by mass media sources Lead and manage mass media virtual assistant(s) Verify and cross-check that expenses for all mass media sources are entered into Salesforce 

Ideal Mass Media Marketing Coordinator Skills:

Highly organized and solutions-oriented

Proactive

Strives to be self-managed 

Self-starter who strives for excellence

Strong, accurate decision maker

Able to operate off limited information and fill in the gaps requiring little management

Analytical

Self-motivated 

Hungry and aggressive mindset of “whatever it takes to get it done”

Focused on assisting and service-minded

Able to operate on tight timelines

Comfortable in navigating conflict

High-energy, people-focused

Successful in avoiding procrastination

Able to operate in a fast-paced work environment

Takes tasks through all the way to the end with excellence

Proficiencies + Growth Opportunities:

Google Drive proficiency: Slides, Sheets, Docs, Calendar

Adobe Creative Cloud: Indesign, Photoshop, Illustrator

Microsoft proficiency

Salesforce 

Media Monitors 

Strong verbal and written communication

Senior Marketing and Office Coordinator

The Senior Marketing and Office Coordinator role is responsible for supporting the marketing department, headquarters office, company, and team with various tasks including but not limited to the following: 

Own all administrative duties of the marketing team with excellence, precision, and timeliness Greet and assist all incoming guests  Manage general marketing email (marketing@markspain.com) and process each email as required Manage award plaques for all MSRE offices  Organize quarterly team culture events  New Agent Business Cards  Comment and review responses across all google, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, indeed, Glassdoor, Yext, and Yelp profiles  Complete agent social media and online audit quarterly  Lead marketing new agent training monthly with all new agents  Agent Facebook Boost requests and reporting  Manage the company’s Zillow presence, including adding and removing agents as they are onboarded or depart  Keep company Intranet up to date, including team and documents pages  Departing agent marketing assistance  Audit agent social media profiles quarterly  Audit all company social media and Google My Business profiles quarterly  Oversee and complete Review Roll Up Monthly  Maintain inventory of printed materials and logo items for each office quarterly Travel to offices twice annually for audits and reviews  Help maintain and update Company Intranet 

This position is on-site Monday-Friday at our Headquarters in Alpharetta, Georgia. 

Manage Office Operations: 

Cleanliness of all areas and appliances  Organization and ordering of all office supplies  Placing orders for office needs  Mail and deliveries  Manage reservation system for common areas  Submit office maintenance requests  Update kitchen photography  Update award plaques  Cleanliness of all office whiteboards  Office keys and keycards  Schedule pick-up with the shredding company  Inventory Tech Equipment and send reports to the Director of IT  Assist with lunches for weekly Stakeholder meetings  Manage team lunch events

Ideal Office & Marketing Specialist Skills: 

Highly organized and solutions-oriented  Proactive  Strives to be self-managed  Self-starter who strives for excellence  Strong, accurate decision maker  Able to operate off limited information and fill in the gaps requiring little management Analytical Self-motivated Hungry and aggressive mindset of “whatever it takes to get it done” Focused on assisting and service-minded  Able to operate on tight timelines  Comfortable in navigating conflict  High-energy, people-focused  Successful in avoiding procrastination  Able to operate in a fast-paced work environment  Takes tasks through all the way to the end with excellence

Proficiencies + Growth Opportunities: 

Google Drive proficiency: Slides, Sheets, Docs, Calendar Canva proficiency  Microsoft proficiency  Salesforce

Compensation and Benefits: 

Base salary with bonus opportunities Eligible for all health benefits Eligible for 401k and PTO 

Team Agent

We are looking for top talent and full-time real estate agents to join our supportive and fun culture. You will receive unparalleled guidance and mentorship from the best in the business, competitive commission with no cap, and guaranteed booked appointments with qualified buyers and sellers. If you are looking to constantly grow and improve, we want to talk to you! We provide marketing and advertising, inside sales department, transaction coordinator support personnel, and an installation service for lockboxes and yard signs. We are looking for agents who are highly motivated, conflict-resolution oriented, have a strong work ethic, exceptional productivity, and are committed to their clients’ experience. You will need to currently hold or be actively working to acquire a real estate license, and experience in sales is preferred. No real estate experience required, but welcome.

Director of Sales

Director of Sales 

Full-Time / 100% In Office Position

About David Marshall Team:

David Marshall Team is a full-service brokerage with the best personalized options to suit our clients’ needs. Additionally, David Marshall Team is the most trusted name in real estate, earning more 5-star reviews than any other firm in the United States. It has earned the No. 1 real estate team in the Nation honor the last four consecutive years by the Wall Street Journal and Real Trends for annual sales production. David Marshall Team is a six-time Inc. 5000 recipient, an annual list honoring the fastest-growing private companies in America. The company was honored in 2017, 2018, 2020 and 2021 as one of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution’s Top Workplaces. It has earned the Atlanta Business Chronicle Pacesetter Award the last five years, as one of metro Atlanta’s 100 top, fastest-growing, privately held companies. David Marshall Team made its fourth appearance on Atlanta’s Top 25 Team Companies annual list in 2021 and made its second appearance on similar lists in both Charlotte and Raleigh.

Currently we are serving six states and 13 markets. Our agents are local, experienced, highly trained, and working full time in the real estate business to make sure your goals are achieved.

The firm had a record sales year again in 2022, with more than $3.8 billion in gross sales volume and sold over 11,200 homes.

About the Role:

Join one of America’s fastest growing companies! We’re looking for an experienced, sales-oriented Director of Sales (DOS)  to join our fast-growing team. The Director of Sales is accountable for fostering the growth and development of a successful sales team focusing attention and effort across two key areas: people and strategy. 

People  

Managing people involves forming and leading an effective sales team as well as creating a team culture that values positive relationships, high productivity and flexibility to meet the needs of our clients, all while achieving the financial goals of the business.

The Director of Sales (DOS) continuously monitors and evaluates the team’s need for talent to ensure the right people are staffed to achieve company goals while serving as a leader in providing coaching and feedback frequently to drive the performance of the individuals on the team.

Strategy 

A successful DOS is a strategic business leader looking at the bigger picture and is constantly engaged in decision-making and problem-solving. Decisions made by the Director of Sales have both immediate and long-term effects on the company.

In this role, you will: 

Meet mutually agreed upon transaction goals established with the MSRE leadership team  Build relationships with the Board of Realtors and agents in the community  Maintain strong relationships with the MSRE leadership team and sales team  Train, coach, and hold direct reports accountable  Develop systems to make the office run efficiently  Develop a talent bench of future leaders  Minimize turnover through effective coaching and weekly accountability sessions  Conduct weekly sales meetings and daily huddles to keep the team focused and on task 

We’re looking for a team member who has:

Bachelors' degree in business, or related field, or equivalent experience 3+ years of sales experience 3+ years of experience leading/managing people, building, and leading a team and resource planning to support the hiring plan of the company  2+ years of real estate experience (Property management, homebuilding, residential, ibuyer, commercial) is  preferred Have or the ability to obtain a Team License(s)  Excellent verbal and written communication skills Skilled at using data to analyze recruiting trends and gaps, diagnose challenges, and develop solutions to improve recruiting Excellent verbal and written communication and team management skills Strong decision-making skills and a sense of urgency Proven success in a fast-paced environment Passion for growing a business Accountable for transaction goals,  Understand financial data and display ownership for profits and losses Look to continue to improve upon the status quo and create efficiencies Focus on an exceptional client experience

Job Skills: 

Analytical Ability, Judgment, Written and Verbal Communication, Ability to Attain Targets, Ability to Get Things Done, Cooperation, Initiative, Dependability, Smart Selection of People, Delegation, Planning and Organizing, Vision, Creativity, Embodying Company Policies, Human Relations, Ability to Develop Subordinates, Problem Solving, Technical Knowledge, Management Knowledge, Policy Knowledge, Common Sense, Enthusiasm, Ability to Work Under Pressure, Customer Focus, Customer Service, Emphasizing Excellence 

Career Level Requirement: Manager 

Experience Required: 3+ to 5 years 

Education Required: Some college coursework completed 

Job Type: Employee 

Job Status: Full time 

We Offer the Following Benefits and Perks:

Compensation will be a combination of base salary and quarterly incentives  Paid time off including vacation, sick time, and paid holidays Full medical, dental, and vision benefits 401K plan 

David Marshall Team  Mission, Vision, and Values Are:

Mission: At MSRE our people come first. Through our culture of excellence, training, education, and specialization we strive to earn our clients’ trust and provide an unparalleled client experience.

Vision: To become the top-of-mind and most trusted name in residential real estate.  To provide our customers with unprecedented service in the real estate industry.  To create a company culture that offers team members the opportunity to succeed, grow, and enrich their lives.

Values:  Have an attitude of excellence, remain customer focused, constantly grow and improve, lead with a servant’s heart, and promote a supportive and fun culture.

More About Us:

Want to learn more about us, please visit our website: http://www.markspain.com

Director of Sales

Director of Sales 

Full-Time / 100% In Office Position

About David Marshall Team:

David Marshall Team is a full-service brokerage with the best personalized options to suit our clients’ needs. Additionally, David Marshall Team is the most trusted name in real estate, earning more 5-star reviews than any other firm in the United States. It has earned the No. 1 real estate team in the Nation honor the last four consecutive years by the Wall Street Journal and Real Trends for annual sales production. David Marshall Team is a six-time Inc. 5000 recipient, an annual list honoring the fastest-growing private companies in America. The company was honored in 2017, 2018, 2020 and 2021 as one of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution’s Top Workplaces. It has earned the Atlanta Business Chronicle Pacesetter Award the last five years, as one of metro Atlanta’s 100 top, fastest-growing, privately held companies. David Marshall Team made its fourth appearance on Atlanta’s Top 25 Team Companies annual list in 2021 and made its second appearance on similar lists in both Charlotte and Raleigh.

Currently we are serving six states and 13 markets. Our agents are local, experienced, highly trained, and working full time in the real estate business to make sure your goals are achieved.

The firm had a record sales year again in 2022, with more than $3.8 billion in gross sales volume and sold over 11,200 homes.

About the Role:

Join one of America’s fastest growing companies! We’re looking for an experienced, sales-oriented Director of Sales (DOS)  to join our fast-growing team. The Director of Sales is accountable for fostering the growth and development of a successful sales team focusing attention and effort across two key areas: people and strategy.

Managing people involves forming and leading an effective sales team as well as creating a team culture that values positive relationships, high productivity and flexibility to meet the needs of our clients, all while achieving the financial goals of the business.

The Director of Sales (DOS) continuously monitors and evaluates the team’s need for talent to ensure the right people are staffed to achieve company goals while serving as a leader in providing coaching and feedback frequently to drive the performance of the individuals on the team.

Strategy 

A successful DOS is a strategic business leader looking at the bigger picture and is constantly engaged in decision-making and problem-solving. Decisions made by the Director of Sales have both immediate and long-term effects on the company.

In this role, you will: 

Meet mutually agreed upon transaction goals established with the MSRE leadership team  Build relationships with the Board of Realtors and agents in the community  Maintain strong relationships with the MSRE leadership team and sales team  Train, coach, and hold direct reports accountable  Develop systems to make the office run efficiently  Develop a talent bench of future leaders  Minimize turnover through effective coaching and weekly accountability sessions  Conduct weekly sales meetings and daily huddles to keep the team focused and on task 

We’re looking for a team member who has:

Bachelors' degree in business, or related field, or equivalent experience 3+ years of sales experience 3+ years of experience leading/managing people, building, and leading a team and resource planning to support the hiring plan of the company  2+ years of real estate experience (Property management, homebuilding, residential, ibuyer, commercial) is  preferred Have or the ability to obtain a Team License(s)  Excellent verbal and written communication skills Skilled at using data to analyze recruiting trends and gaps, diagnose challenges, and develop solutions to improve recruiting Excellent verbal and written communication and team management skills Strong decision-making skills and a sense of urgency Proven success in a fast-paced environment Passion for growing a business Accountable for transaction goals,  Understand financial data and display ownership for profits and losses Look to continue to improve upon the status quo and create efficiencies Focus on an exceptional client experience

Job Skills: 

Analytical Ability, Judgment, Written and Verbal Communication, Ability to Attain Targets, Ability to Get Things Done, Cooperation, Initiative, Dependability, Smart Selection of People, Delegation, Planning and Organizing, Vision, Creativity, Embodying Company Policies, Human Relations, Ability to Develop Subordinates, Problem Solving, Technical Knowledge, Management Knowledge, Policy Knowledge, Common Sense, Enthusiasm, Ability to Work Under Pressure, Customer Focus, Customer Service, Emphasizing Excellence 

Career Level Requirement: Manager 

Experience Required: 3+ to 5 years 

Education Required: Some college coursework completed 

Job Type: Employee 

Job Status: Full time 

We Offer the Following Benefits and Perks:

Compensation will be a combination of base salary and quarterly incentives  Paid time off including vacation, sick time, and paid holidays Full medical, dental, and vision benefits 401K plan

Associate Director of Sales

The Associate Director of Sales position involves many of the tasks and activities required to accomplish the closing goals of the affiliated market center. They will assist the Director of Sales with developing systems to make the office run smoothly, building a talent bench of future leaders, reducing turnover by increasing per agent productivity, and meeting mutually agreed upon KPI metrics established with the MSRE Senior Leadership Team.

The ideal candidate will be someone who displays passion for growing a business, holds themselves accountable to transaction goals, looks continually to improve status-quos and create efficiencies, focuses on an exceptional client experience, maintains a high commitment to personal and professional growth, and leads with a servant’s heart.

The Associate Director of Sales will require a willingness to do whatever it takes, including but not limited to relocating, to meet closing targets while delivering an excellent client experience. A strong Associate Director of Sales  will take ownership of the fostering and development of a successful sales team as the entire organization relies on the team to close homes. The Associate Director must be disciplined about their time and task focused to successfully complete their work.

Team Agent

We are looking for top talent and full-time real estate agents to join our supportive and fun culture. You will receive unparalleled guidance and mentorship from the best in the business, competitive commission with no cap, and guaranteed booked appointments with qualified buyers and sellers. If you are looking to constantly grow and improve, we want to talk to you! We provide marketing and advertising, inside sales department, transaction coordinator support personnel, and an installation service for lockboxes and yard signs. We are looking for agents who are highly motivated, conflict-resolution oriented, have a strong work ethic, exceptional productivity, and are committed to their clients’ experience. You will need to currently hold or be actively working to acquire a real estate license, and experience in sales is preferred. No real estate experience required, but welcome.

Team Agent

We are looking for top talent and full-time real estate agents to join our supportive and fun culture. You will receive unparalleled guidance and mentorship from the best in the business, competitive commission with no cap, and guaranteed booked appointments with qualified buyers and sellers. If you are looking to constantly grow and improve, we want to talk to you! We provide marketing and advertising, inside sales department, transaction coordinator support personnel, and an installation service for lockboxes and yard signs. We are looking for agents who are highly motivated, conflict-resolution oriented, have a strong work ethic, exceptional productivity, and are committed to their clients’ experience. You will need to currently hold or be actively working to acquire a real estate license, and experience in sales is preferred. No real estate experience required, but welcome.

Director of Sales

Director of Sales 

Full-Time / 100% In Office Position

About David Marshall Team:

David Marshall Team is a full-service brokerage with the best personalized options to suit our clients’ needs. Additionally, David Marshall Team is the most trusted name in real estate, earning more 5-star reviews than any other firm in the United States. It has earned the No. 1 real estate team in the Nation honor the last four consecutive years by the Wall Street Journal and Real Trends for annual sales production. David Marshall Team is a six-time Inc. 5000 recipient, an annual list honoring the fastest-growing private companies in America. The company was honored in 2017, 2018, 2020 and 2021 as one of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution’s Top Workplaces. It has earned the Atlanta Business Chronicle Pacesetter Award the last five years, as one of metro Atlanta’s 100 top, fastest-growing, privately held companies. David Marshall Team made its fourth appearance on Atlanta’s Top 25 Team Companies annual list in 2021 and made its second appearance on similar lists in both Charlotte and Raleigh.

Currently we are serving six states and 13 markets. Our agents are local, experienced, highly trained, and working full time in the real estate business to make sure your goals are achieved.

The firm had a record sales year again in 2022, with more than $3.8 billion in gross sales volume and sold over 11,200 homes.

About the Role:

Join one of America’s fastest growing companies! We’re looking for an experienced, sales-oriented Director of Sales (DOS)  to join our fast-growing team. The Director of Sales is accountable for fostering the growth and development of a successful sales team focusing attention and effort across two key areas: people and strategy. 

People  

Managing people involves forming and leading an effective sales team as well as creating a team culture that values positive relationships, high productivity and flexibility to meet the needs of our clients, all while achieving the financial goals of the business.

The Director of Sales (DOS) continuously monitors and evaluates the team’s need for talent to ensure the right people are staffed to achieve company goals while serving as a leader in providing coaching and feedback frequently to drive the performance of the individuals on the team.

Strategy 

A successful DOS is a strategic business leader looking at the bigger picture and is constantly engaged in decision-making and problem-solving. Decisions made by the Director of Sales have both immediate and long-term effects on the company.

In this role, you will: 

Meet mutually agreed upon transaction goals established with the MSRE leadership team  Build relationships with the Board of Realtors and agents in the community  Maintain strong relationships with the MSRE leadership team and sales team  Train, coach, and hold direct reports accountable  Develop systems to make the office run efficiently  Develop a talent bench of future leaders  Minimize turnover through effective coaching and weekly accountability sessions  Conduct weekly sales meetings and daily huddles to keep the team focused and on task 

We’re looking for a team member who has:

Bachelors' degree in business, or related field, or equivalent experience 3+ years of sales experience 3+ years of experience leading/managing people, building, and leading a team and resource planning to support the hiring plan of the company  2+ years of real estate experience (Property management, homebuilding, residential, ibuyer, commercial) is  preferred Have or the ability to obtain a Team License(s)  Excellent verbal and written communication skills Skilled at using data to analyze recruiting trends and gaps, diagnose challenges, and develop solutions to improve recruiting Excellent verbal and written communication and team management skills Strong decision-making skills and a sense of urgency Proven success in a fast-paced environment Passion for growing a business Accountable for transaction goals,  Understand financial data and display ownership for profits and losses Look to continue to improve upon the status quo and create efficiencies Focus on an exceptional client experience

Job Skills: 

Analytical Ability, Judgment, Written and Verbal Communication, Ability to Attain Targets, Ability to Get Things Done, Cooperation, Initiative, Dependability, Smart Selection of People, Delegation, Planning and Organizing, Vision, Creativity, Embodying Company Policies, Human Relations, Ability to Develop Subordinates, Problem Solving, Technical Knowledge, Management Knowledge, Policy Knowledge, Common Sense, Enthusiasm, Ability to Work Under Pressure, Customer Focus, Customer Service, Emphasizing Excellence 

Career Level Requirement: Manager 

Experience Required: 3+ to 5 years 

Education Required: Some college coursework completed 

Job Type: Employee 

Job Status: Full time 

We Offer the Following Benefits and Perks:

Compensation will be a combination of base salary and quarterly incentives  Paid time off including vacation, sick time, and paid holidays Full medical, dental, and vision benefits 401K plan 

David Marshall Team  Mission, Vision, and Values Are:

Mission: At MSRE our people come first. Through our culture of excellence, training, education, and specialization we strive to earn our clients’ trust and provide an unparalleled client experience.

Vision: To become the top-of-mind and most trusted name in residential real estate.  To provide our customers with unprecedented service in the real estate industry.  To create a company culture that offers team members the opportunity to succeed, grow, and enrich their lives.

Values:  Have an attitude of excellence, remain customer focused, constantly grow and improve, lead with a servant’s heart, and promote a supportive and fun culture.

More About Us:

Want to learn more about us, please visit our website: http://www.markspain.com

Team Agent

We are looking for top talent and full-time real estate agents to join our supportive and fun culture. You will receive unparalleled guidance and mentorship from the best in the business, competitive commission with no cap, and guaranteed booked appointments with qualified buyers and sellers. If you are looking to constantly grow and improve, we want to talk to you! We provide marketing and advertising, inside sales department, transaction coordinator support personnel, and an installation service for lockboxes and yard signs. We are looking for agents who are highly motivated, conflict-resolution oriented, have a strong work ethic, exceptional productivity, and are committed to their clients’ experience. You will need to currently hold or be actively working to acquire a real estate license, and experience in sales is preferred. No real estate experience required, but welcome.

Associate Director of Sales

The Associate Director of Sales position involves many of the tasks and activities required to accomplish the closing goals of the affiliated market center. They will assist the Director of Sales with developing systems to make the office run smoothly, building a talent bench of future leaders, reducing turnover by increasing per agent productivity, and meeting mutually agreed upon KPI metrics established with the MSRE Senior Leadership Team.

The ideal candidate will be someone who displays passion for growing a business, holds themselves accountable to transaction goals, looks continually to improve status-quos and create efficiencies, focuses on an exceptional client experience, maintains a high commitment to personal and professional growth, and leads with a servant’s heart.

The Associate Director of Sales will require a willingness to do whatever it takes, including but not limited to relocating, to meet closing targets while delivering an excellent client experience. A strong Associate Director of Sales  will take ownership of the fostering and development of a successful sales team as the entire organization relies on the team to close homes. The Associate Director must be disciplined about their time and task focused to successfully complete their work.

Team Agent

We are looking for top talent and full-time real estate agents to join our supportive and fun culture. You will receive unparalleled guidance and mentorship from the best in the business, competitive commission with no cap, and guaranteed booked appointments with qualified buyers and sellers. Our people come first.

At David Marshall Team, we foster a fun and supportive culture, lead with a servant's heart and hold each other accountable to deliver an unparalleled client experience.

We care about your growth.

We provide the training and education you need to be a successful real estate agent - and fast! It’s about opportunity and growing both your real estate career and you personally. Additionally, our leaders offer the mentorship and knowledge you need to be a better realtor and to better serve our customers.
